messages.subject: Re: Air Force
messages.msgSnippet: ... It s you and me, Christy! I ve been googling, trying to find some hint of other families, but nothing so far. ... That s great news. Enjoy! --aj
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "unschooling1"
<unschooling1@y...> wrote:
>
> Thought I'd change the subject:) Are there really other Air Force
> families who unschool? I sure wish I could find just one!

It's you and me, Christy! I've been googling, trying to find some
hint of other families, but nothing so far.

>
> OT - dh is coming home on Monday after 4 long months deployed to
> Qatar! YAY!

That's great news. Enjoy!

--aj

messages.subject: Re: Air Force
messages.msgSnippet: Don t let the opportunities to see things and go places get ... Kelly, I know you are right, but I also lack initiative:)  Dh has been gone a long time, and I
messages.messageBody:
Don't let the opportunities to see things and go places get
> lost in the desire to come home!

Kelly, I know you are right, but I also lack initiative:) Dh has
been gone a long time, and I don't feel comfortable driving around
Turkey by myself. We have gone on a few trips here though -
Cappadocia was amazing!


but the Northwest seems more
> unschooling-friendly than the South! <G>

That's what I'm hoping! I have spent enough time in the south and
want to try somewhere new. We've never lived out west before and
are really looking forward to it.


> >>>>OT - dh is coming home on Monday after 4 long months deployed
to
> Qatar! YAY!<<<<
> Congratulations! What does he do?

Thanks! He works in Intelligence - mostly analysis and passing on of
info to air crews, also some targeting.

And Leslie, thank you also for your good wishes. It will be an
adjustment for all of us, but a good one I think. I'm just
wondering what the cat will do:) We had her for only a month before
dh left, so she'll probably be hiding for a while.

-Christy

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Air Force
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/14/2005 9:40:35 A.M. Eastern Standard Time, Leslie530@aol.com writes: like  Kelly says...who also gets on to me about  my lack of ability
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/14/2005 9:40:35 A.M. Eastern Standard Time,
Leslie530@... writes:

like Kelly says...who also gets on to me about my
lack of ability to meet friends!).

Leslie in SC<<<<

NOT lack of *ability*---Leslie's adorable! Lack of *initiative*!

~Kelly

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Air Force
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/14/2005 2:54:53 A.M. Eastern Standard Time, unschooling1@yahoo.com writes: OT -  dh is coming home on Monday after 4 long months deployed
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/14/2005 2:54:53 A.M. Eastern Standard Time,
unschooling1@... writes:


OT - dh is coming home on Monday after 4 long months deployed to
Qatar! YAY!

-Christy



****************************

As one of the few and proud Marine Corps unschooler's, YAY!!! Enjoy your
reunion.

Good luck with your move, too. I hope you meet lots of great people in WA
(well, and in Turkey, too, like Kelly says...who also gets on to me about my
lack of ability to meet friends!).

Leslie in SC


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Air Force
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/14/2005 2:55:00 A.M. Eastern Standard Time, unschooling1@yahoo.com writes: Thought  I d change the subject:)  Are there really other Air
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/14/2005 2:55:00 A.M. Eastern Standard Time,
unschooling1@... writes:

Thought I'd change the subject:) Are there really other Air Force
families who unschool? <<<<

A few. Scattered here & there.

>>>>>> I sure wish I could find just one! We're in
Turkey right now, and we are so happy to be leaving in a couple of
months. <<<<<

I know you've heard it before, but I'll say it again: enjoy it while you're
there 'cause you'll miss it when you're gone! Take advantage of the time you
have there----what an experience! And the bargains! Rugs, copper, brass! The
Mediterranean! Don't let the opportunities to see things and go places get
lost in the desire to come home!

>>>> We haven't made any real friends at all since we've been
here. <<<<

You might make one next week! <g> We often *really* liked the family we were
replacing! <g> But we only got to know them for a few weeks/months!

>>>>>We'll be moving to Spokane, WA in the spring and are hoping
to find someone since it's a good sized city.<<<<

I don't know of anyone there, off-hand, but the Northwest seems more
unschooling-friendly than the South! <G>


>>>>OT - dh is coming home on Monday after 4 long months deployed to
Qatar! YAY!<<<<
Congratulations! What does he do?

~Kelly






[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Air Force
messages.msgSnippet: Thought I d change the subject:)  Are there really other Air Force families who unschool?  I sure wish I could find just one!  We re in Turkey right now, and
messages.messageBody:
Thought I'd change the subject:) Are there really other Air Force
families who unschool? I sure wish I could find just one! We're in
Turkey right now, and we are so happy to be leaving in a couple of
months. We haven't made any real friends at all since we've been
here. We'll be moving to Spokane, WA in the spring and are hoping
to find someone since it's a good sized city.

OT - dh is coming home on Monday after 4 long months deployed to
Qatar! YAY!

-Christy
